topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: KVM + ESX Deployment Architecture Reference

othermeta.name: role
othermeta.content: Sameer V, Pranoy R, Michael B

body.p: This page introduces deployment and network architectures of the KVM + ESX deployment of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

section.title: Deployment architecture
section.p: The following diagram depicts a simplified deployment scenario of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.
The following sections describe essential aspects of this diagram.

section.title: Network architecture
section.p: The following information describes the network configuration, which must be configured by the network administrator.

row.entry: Cloud Management Network and Object Store Network. Shared between the non-KVM and KVM regions.
Consumer Access Network. Shared between the non-KVM and KVM regions.
External network (FIP network for the non-KVM region) region).
IPMI/iLO network. Shared between the non-KVM and KVM regions.
Block Storage Network. Shared between the non-KVM and KVM regions.
Data Center Management network (accessible to the non-KVM and KVM region).
Tenant Underlay Network for the non-KVM region; routed across multi-DC for VxLAN 12 extension
Tenant Underlay Network for the KVM region
Boot/initial configuration network for the KVM region. Untagged
External network (FIP network for KVM region)

section.title: Interfaces
section.p: The following are the interfaces being used, based on the technical architecture diagram. You can use more than two interfaces and specific networks to physical networks.

ul.li: Intf0 is mapped to Port1/Bonded Pair
Intf1 is mapped to Port2/Bonded Pair
Intfn are Multiple Provider Networks or SR-IOV interfaces.

section.title: Routing ACLs
section.p: Configure the following routing access lists.

row.entry: Access NTP, DNS, LDAP, StoreVirtual APIs, and so forth
Access iLO network for managing the lifecycle of the node
Access external networks, for example to download patches

entry.p: VSC IP to HLM CLM VM IP (only during deployment)
VSD IP to ESX host CLM IP (during VRS-vAp deployment)

row.entry: Inter DC communication (VPN tunnel, BGP, MPLS)
Inter DC communication (VPN tunnel, BGP, MPLS)

section.p: CLM, PXE, BLS, WR-PXE, WR-INFRA, WR-TUL should use RFC 1918 non-routable IPs to prevent access to the CLM network from DCM, CTL, or EXT.
DCM, CAN/WR-OAM, EXT, WR-EXT should use routable IPs. DCM is restricted to the corporate network
